1.text: It is the part of man to prepare the soul: and of the Lord to govern the tongue.

2.text: All the ways of a man are open to his eyes: the Lord is the weigher of spirits.

3.text: Lay open thy works to the Lord: and thy thoughts shall be directed.

4.text: The Lord hath made all things for himself: the wicked also for the evil day.

5.text: Every proud man is an abomination to the Lord: though hand should be joined to hand, he is not innocent. The beginning of a good way is to do justice; and this is more acceptable with God, than to offer sacrifices.

6.text: By mercy and truth iniquity is redeemed: and by the fear of the Lord men depart from evil.

7.text: When the ways of man shall please the Lord, he will convert even his enemies to peace.

8.text: Better is a little with justice, than great revenues with iniquity.

9.text: The heart of man disposeth his way: but the Lord must direct his steps.

10.text: Divination is in the lips of the king, his mouth shall not err in judgment.

11.text: Weight and balance are judgments of the Lord: and his work all the weights of the bag.

12.text: They that act wickedly are abominable to the king: for the throne is established by justice.

13.text: Just lips are the delight of kings: he that speaketh right things shall be loved.

14.text: The wrath of a king is as messengers of death : and the wise man will pacify it.

15.text: In the cheerfulness of the kingâ€™s countenance is life: and his clemency is like the latter rain.

16.text: Get wisdom, because it is better than gold: and purchase prudence, for it is more precious than silver.

17.text: The path of the just departeth from evils: he that keepeth his soul keepeth his way.

18.text: Pride goeth before destruction: and the spirit is lifted up before a fall.

19.text: It is better to be humbled with the meek, than to divide spoils with the proud.

20.text: The learned in word shall find good things: and he that trusteth in the Lord is blessed.

21.text: The wise in heart shall be called prudent: and he that is sweet in words shall attain to greater things.

22.text: Knowledge is a fountain of life to him that possesseth it: the instruction of fools is foolishness.

23.text: The heart of the wise shall instruct his mouth: and shall add grace to his lips.

24.text: Well ordered words are as a honeycomb: sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.

25.text: There is a way that seemeth to a man right: and the ends thereof lead to death.

26.text: The soul of him that laboureth, laboureth for himself, because his mouth hath obliged him to it.

27.text: The wicked man diggeth evil, and in his lips is a burning fire.

28.text: A perverse man stirreth up quarrels: and one full of words separateth princes.

29.text: An unjust man allureth his friend: and leadeth him into a way that is not good

30.text: He that with fixed eyes deviseth?? wicked things, biting his lips, bringeth: evil to pass.

31.text: Old age is a crown of dignity, when it is found in the ways of justice.

32.text: The patient man is better than the valiant: and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh cities.

33.text: Lots are cast into the lap, but they are disposed of by the Lord.
